channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2882] What's The Scariest Part Of This Photo?
[+2781] Canada Takes Out USA in OT, Wins Gold Medal in Men's Hockey
item.description: Team Canada avenged its loss a week ago to Team USA when it counted, by beating the Americans 3-2 in overtime to win gold at the Olympics.

item.title: [+1681] All About Google (INFOGRAPHIC)
item.description: Everything about Google from how they make all their cash, to the composition of their workforce, to tidbits about Google's culture (a Googler n00b: Noogler)

item.title: [+1525] A Fact Of Life: [PIC]
[+1378] Can't find a book you're looking for? You're in the... (pic)
[+1269] Sorry for your loss! (PIC)
[+1254] Apple admits: Chinese 'Kids' were used to build iPods etc
item.description: Apple has admitted that child labour was used at the Chinese factories that build its computers, iPods and mobile phones. At least eleven 15-year-old children were discovered to be working last year in three factories which supply Apple.

item.title: [+1229] 25 Nostalgic Photos Comparing Past to the Present
item.description: 25 photos that compare past snapshots of buildings, locations, structures, and people with the present day scene.

item.title: [+1168] GOP Rep - Blacks Were Better Off Under Slavery
item.description: Rep. Trent Franks (R) of Arizona has long been one of Congress's most embarrassing members. But this week, the right-wing lawmaker may have reached a new depth. In a recent interview Franks said "…Far more of the African American community is being devastated by the policies of today than were being devastated by the policies of slavery."

item.title: [+1119] Pac-Man hidden in LG logo [Pic]
[+1060] Rare Nintendo game sells on ebay for $40,000
item.description: It's thought to be one of only two shrinkwrapped copies of the game still in existence.

item.title: [+873] Fox News Flunks Geography -- Again (pic)
[+815] Warren Buffett: Punish Big (Failed & Still Rich) Bankers
item.description: Warren Buffett says big-bank bosses who drove their companies to near ruin -- and who tax payers bailed out -- should pay a steeper price for their failures.

item.title: [+800] Let them eat applesauce: Right-wing media mock the uninsured
item.description: Right-wing media figures have mocked Democrats' descriptions of hardships faced by their constituents who lack health insurance, including a story Rep. Louise Slaughter told about a woman who wore dentures that previously belonged to her dead sister. For example, Rush Limbaugh said, "So if you don't have any teeth, so what? What's applesauce for?"

item.title: [+712] An Infrared View of the Galaxy [PIC]
item.description: This sweeping panorama is the sharpest infrared picture ever made of the Galactic core. The center of our Milky Way galaxy reveals a new population of massive stars and new details in complex structures in the hot ionized gas swirling around the central 300 light-years.

item.title: [+651] Now That's Just Wrong
[+649] Sky of fire [PIC]
[+570] Alight!: Extraordinary photograph [PIC]
item.description: By Chris Pietsch: A gray jay swoops in for a landing amid the fir trees along the snow-covered shores of Odell Lake as the sun rises over the Oregon Cascades. Gray jays are able to survive over the winter at higher elevations because of their unique habit of caching food in undersides of tree branches or in holes in the bark using a sticky mucous s

item.title: [+532] 6 Free Android Apps That Will Make You Drop Your iPhone
item.description: If you’re looking for a change, or you’re in the smartphone market and still weighing the pros and cons, consider these Android-only apps and how they might fit into your work, play, and mobile lifestyle.
